author: G. M
title: Superb hotel, in a Superb location
text:
My wife booked the break for my 65th birthday. She reviewed the hotel and booked for 5 days. Travelled by East Midlands rail to St. Pancras and then Eurostar to Paris. Took a short bus ride 39 or 48 to the hotel for 2 euros each, think taxis are approx. 10-15 euros, Eurostar will organise a taxi for 27 euros each way but I think it's fun travelling like the locals. On arrival we were greeted with a smile and very professionally dealt with by Edwin but all the staff are nice, friendly and professional, especially Yosef. The size of room was good as the beds are enormous and tastefully decorated in a modern way.
Breakfast was good, although if large parties are staying (Chinese /German) the bread seems to disappear quickly, taken for sandwiches. Afternoon tea 4-6pm is welcome after a day's sight seeing, then a swim/soak in a nice warm pool, there are also several exercise bikes (instructions in French) and a couple of mats, weights and Swiss balls for training in an adjoining room. The hotel is very well situated in a nice area close to quality bistros and restaurants, we'd recommend Le Grand Colbert which isn't cheap and pre booking is a must, also the 3 course set menu at Restaurant 58 on the Eiffel Tower is good especially late afternoon/evening and it's approx. a 10 minute walk down to the Seine/Louvre. All in all, a very, very good hotel at a reasonable cost.
Room Tip: We were on the 4th floor, it was quiet and had character See more room tips
